_comment: Created by EFisher on 25/02/2014 18:25:00 using v2.0
title: How have treatment waiting times changed by pathway?
analysis_commentary:
The longer-term trend for the median wait time from referral to treatment for admitted people has slightly increased from 2008 and was 8.7 weeks in November 2013. The median number of weeks from referral to treatment for incomplete pathways has decreased over time and has been between five and six weeks since January 2012. For non-admitted pathways, the long-term trend shows the median wait time has been around four weeks since February 2008. However since February 2012, the median has been increasing, most noticeably since March 2013.

For more information on the different pathways, please see 'about this data'.
data_source: NHS England, Referral to Treatment waiting times
